description:
The story centers around the special abilities that occur among a small percentage of boys and girls in puberty. Yuu Otosaka uses his power without others knowing, and lives a fairly normal, average school life. Before him suddenly appears a girl, Nao Tomori. Due to his meeting with her, the fate of special power-users will be exposed.

(Source: Anime News Network)

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Time Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features time-traveling or other time-warping phenomena.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Body Swapping
tags.description: Centers around individuals swapping bodies with one another.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Amnesia
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) with memory loss.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Mahjong
tags.description: Centered around the game of mahjong.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Slapstick
tags.description: Prominently features comedy based on deliberately clumsy actions or embarrassing events.

tags.name: Delinquents
tags.description: Features characters with a notorious image and attitude, sometimes referred to as "yankees".

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Tomboy
tags.description: Features a girl who exhibits characteristics or behaviors considered in many cultures to be typical of boys.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Baseball
tags.description: Centers around the sport of baseball.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

title.native: Charlotte The 4コマ せーしゅんを駆け抜けろ!

node.description:
__Graduated:__ Chuukyou University (Department of Psychology)

__Introduction:__
Jun Maeda is a Japanese scriptwriter, lyricist, composer and music producer. He is known as one of the founding members of the software company Key, and he is the main composer and original creator for most of Key's visual novels. His most notable works are Kanon (Mai and Makoto routes), Air, Clannad, Angel Beats!, Tomoyo After, and Little Busters!. Maeda also worked on Summer Pockets, which he claimed "needed to make readers cry or it would mean the end for Key".

__Biography:__
Before forming Key, Maeda worked for the company Tactics where he had a hand in the creation of two games for that company: Moon and One: Kagayaku Kisetsu e.

__Graduated:__ Chuukyou University (Department of Psychology)

Originating from [Production I.G](https://anilist.co/studio/10/), currently affilaited with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/).
**Iida Satoki** is a Japanese freelance sound director.
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Higashiji)

[Official Website](https://lia-music.jp/) | [Twitter](https://x.com/Liabobo3) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/lia_vocalist/?hl=en)

She is affiliated with the group, Veil.  Sampling voice for Vocaloid, [IA](https://anilist.co/staff/124349/IA)

__Birthplace:__ Tokyo, Japan

[Official Website/Profile (SSP)](http://ssp-create.com/tadaaoi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tada_aoi) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCuAkxJn7ZlqVOLdiRQIeJVA) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/多田葵) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Aoi_Tada)

Aoi Tada is a Japanese singer and former voice actress. She formerly belonged to Gekidan Himawari. Her most noted voice role is [Ed](https://anilist.co/character/16/) in [Cowboy Bebop](https://anilist.co/anime/1/). She also performed an insert song to the series, "Wo Qui Non Coin."

In March 2005, she signed on to Moon-Bunny Entertainment and began her singer-songwriting career. She has performed theme songs for shows such as [Gunslinger Girl: Il Teatrino](https://anilist.co/anime/3231/), [Angel Beats!](https://anilist.co/anime/6547/) and [Charlotte](https://anilist.co/anime/20997/). She is also affiliated with the group Veil. She is credited for her Veil-related songs as Veil ∞ Aoi.

As of 2005, she has retired from voice acting but is still active as a singer.

(Source: Wikipedia)

Originally an animator.

Rafael Antonio "Tony" Olivier is a Puerto Rican-born American voice actor best known for voicing Rick Hunter from Robotech, Lancer from Fate/stay night, and Arsène Lupin III from Lupin the Third. He helped produce the live action shows Mighty Morphin Power Rangers and VR Troopers.

Rieke Werner, also known under the pseudonym StrawbellyCake, is a German voice actress and singer.
